item.title: Visible homeless way up in OKC for 2018, overall homeless numbers down
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Point-in-Time Count report on homelessness in Oklahoma City released Thursday showed the total number of homeless people is down, but the homeless living outdoors is up drastically. This year’s count was conducted in the very early hours of January 25 by volunteers coordinated by City of Oklahoma City staff in the Community Development Division […]

The post Visible homeless way up in OKC for 2018, overall homeless numbers down appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Police duties, social work mix with Homeless Outreach Team
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Homeless Outreach Team within the Oklahoma City Police Department is tasked to connect the city’s homeless population with agencies and organizations. They have a unique role that not all officers, and most city residents, don’t understand. “When I first came onto this unit, a senior officer said that all I was doing on the […]

The post Police duties, social work mix with Homeless Outreach Team appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Single day count reveals number of homeless in Oklahoma City
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
About 80 volunteers gathered at the OKC Homeless Alliance West Town facility Thursday morning at NW 4th and Virginia before there was even a glimmer of light on the horizon. They were preparing to do the annual Point-in-Time count of the homeless in Oklahoma City, a requirement of the Housing and Urban Development department for […]

The post Single day count reveals number of homeless in Oklahoma City appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
